children.subject: My total midterm and final scores are 17 above the A boundaries, but got A- at last.
<md>I got a border A- in MT and middle B in Final and 96% in HW and B+...</md>

This is true, they never released the mean/median, so I am not sure where the "mean is a B" sentiment came from. 

Also, with 3 hw drops, I'm sure the scores on homework were very high for most people. Without 3 hw drops, I had a percent in the low 80s for hw grade, but with the 3 hw drops, I had more than a 97%. So we don't know the mean of hw scores either (I assume it was in the mid to high 90s, esp since they said your final grade is likely to match your midterm score if you have a 95% in hw)
<md>Helix: but this is a "binned class" as per what staff claims, do they expect everyone got 100% in HW?</md>

I honestly believe they expected everyone to get between 95 and 100 on hw after 3 drops, so hw grades didn't really affect binning, since everyone's scores were railed near A+. It seems as if our test scores were the main determining factor for our final grade, even with an A+ in hw (at least for me, my final grade was exactly between my midterm and final scores, which were way lower than an A+)

Also, a bunch of people on piazza and all the people I knew in the class had at least a 94 on hw, so I find it hard to believe that was a huge range of hw scores to differentiate students by.
I also took EECS 127 this semester, but I'm pretty sure the mean/distribution for exams was never released, and they only gave us the approximate grade bins?

history.content: I wonder whether the grading policy for EECS 127 is reasonable. For the former years, the average is B+. I get roughly 94% on homework. I get the mean score for both midterm and final, the middle of the B range. But I get a B at last. This class uses the same grade bin for graduates and undergraduates, which I think is kind of unfair. I spent lots of time in this class, roughly two days every week, not doing badly at homework. Getting a B really frustrates me.
history.subject: EECS 127 Grading policy
